column2: 1.--Portugal Iced Pudding.
column3: one.--Portugal Iced Pudding.

column2: Then place in the freezer to harden and serve.
column3: Then place in the freezer to harden and serve.

column2: 2.--English Chicken Salad.
column3: two.--English Chicken Salad.

column2: Mix 1 cup of cold chicken cut fine with 1 cup of chopped celery, 1 cup of cooked chestnuts chopped and 2 green peppers cut fine.
column3: Mix one cup of cold chicken cut fine with one cup of chopped celery, one cup of cooked chestnuts chopped and two green peppers cut fine.

column2: Season with salt and pepper.
column3: Season with salt and pepper.

column2: Put on crisp lettuce leaves in the salad bowl; cover with a mayonnaise dressing.
column3: Put on crisp lettuce leaves in the salad bowl; cover with a mayonnaise dressing.

column2: Serve cold.
column3: Serve cold.

column2: 3.--Turkish Stewed Lamb.
column3: three.--Turkish Stewed Lamb.

column2: Lay in a large stew-pan and cover with hot water.
column3: Lay in a large stew pan and cover with hot water.

column2: Add 1 sliced onion, 2 sliced green peppers and 2 tomatoes, 1 red pepper and 2 sprigs of parsley.
column3: Add one sliced onion, two sliced green peppers and two tomatoes, one red pepper and two sprigs of parsley.

column2: Let stew slowly until tender.
column3: Let stew slowly until tender.

column2: Then fry thin slices of egg-plant and add to the stew.
column3: Then fry thin slices of egg plant and add to the stew.

column2: Serve hot.
column3: Serve hot.

column2: 4.--Irish Apple Pudding.
column3: four.--Irish Apple Pudding.

column2: Pare and slice apples and lay them in a buttered pie-dish.
column3: Pare and slice apples and lay them in a buttered pie dish.

column2: Then cover with a rich pie-paste and let bake until done.
column3: Then cover with a rich pie paste and let bake until done.

column2: 5.--Indian Rice.
column3: five.--Indian Rice.

column2: Boil 1 cup of rice in chicken broth; add a pinch of curry-powder and season to taste with salt and pepper.
column3: Boil one cup of rice in chicken broth; add a pinch of curry powder and season to taste with salt and pepper.

column2: Serve very hot.
column3: Serve very hot.

column2: 6.--Hungarian Chicken Soup.
column3: six.--Hungarian Chicken Soup.

column2: Boil a large chicken in 3 quarts of water; season with salt, sage and pepper; add 1 onion chopped and cook until tender.
column3: Boil a large chicken in three quarts of water; season with salt, sage and pepper; add one onion chopped and cook until tender.

column2: Remove the chicken and chop it fine; then add to the soup with the yolks of 3 well-beaten eggs; let all get very hot.
column3: Remove the chicken and chop it fine; then add to the soup with the yolks of three well beaten eggs; let all get very hot.

column2: Sprinkle with chopped parsley and serve at once.
column3: Sprinkle with chopped parsley and serve at once.

column2: 7.--Yorkshire Pudding.
column3: seven.--Yorkshire Pudding.

column2: Beat 3 eggs with a pinch of salt; add 1 pint of milk and 2/3 of a cup of flour.
column3: Beat three eggs with a pinch of salt; add one pint of milk and two thirds of a cup of flour.

column2: Stir until smooth.
column3: Stir until smooth.

column2: Then pour into a well-greased pan and bake until done.
column3: Then pour into a well greased pan and bake until done.

column2: Serve with English roast-beef, and pour over the gravy.
column3: Serve with English roast beef, and pour over the gravy.

column2: 8.--Portugal Salad.
column3: eight.--Portugal Salad.

column2: Slice 2 cucumbers, 2 tomatoes, 1 onion and two green peppers.
column3: Slice two cucumbers, two tomatoes, one onion and two green peppers.

column2: Then sprinkle with 1 chopped clove of garlic, salt and pepper and cover with some thin slices of bread.
column3: Then sprinkle with one chopped clove of garlic, salt and pepper and cover with some thin slices of bread.

column2: 9.--English Chocolate Pudding.
column3: nine.--English Chocolate Pudding.

column2: Soak 6 ounces of bread-crumbs in milk and press dry; add 2 ounces of butter mixed with 3 ounces of sugar and 3 ounces of chocolate; add the yolks of 6 eggs well beaten, and flavor with a teaspoonful of vanilla; add the whites beaten to a stiff froth.
column3: Soak six ounces of bread crumbs in milk and press dry; add two ounces of butter mixed with three ounces of sugar and three ounces of chocolate; add the yolks of six eggs well beaten, and flavor with a teaspoonful of vanilla; add the whites beaten to a stiff froth.

column2: Bake in a quick oven and serve at once.
column3: Bake in a quick oven and serve at once.

column2: 10.--Spanish Canapes.
column3: ten.--Spanish Canapes.

column2: Prepare circular pieces of buttered toast.
column3: Prepare circular pieces of buttered toast.

column2: Then mix 1 cup of chopped fish with 3 sweet pickles minced fine, and 2 tablespoonfuls of Madras chutney; moisten with 2 tablespoonfuls of Hollandaise sauce.
column3: Then mix one cup of chopped fish with three sweet pickles minced fine, and two tablespoonfuls of Madras chutney; moisten with two tablespoonfuls of Hollandaise sauce.

column2: Spread this mixture over 8 pieces of toast; sprinkle with 3 tablespoonfuls of grated Parmesan cheese.
column3: Spread this mixture over eight pieces of toast; sprinkle with three tablespoonfuls of grated Parmesan cheese.

column2: Let bake for five minutes and serve.
column3: Let bake for five minutes and serve.

column2: 11.--French Strawberry Pudding.
column3: eleven.--French Strawberry Pudding.

column2: Dip enough macaroons in wine to line the pudding-dish; cover with sweetened strawberries.
column3: Dip enough macaroons in wine to line the pudding dish; cover with sweetened strawberries.

column2: Beat the yolks of 4 eggs with sugar and flavor with vanilla; pour over the strawberries; put in the oven to bake. Beat the whites to a stiff froth with some pulverized sugar; put on top of the pudding and let brown.
column3: Beat the yolks of four eggs with sugar and flavor with vanilla; pour over the strawberries; put in the oven to bake. Beat the whites to a stiff froth with some pulverized sugar; put on top of the pudding and let brown.

column2: Serve cold.
column3: Serve cold.

column2: Chop cold veal.
column3: Chop cold veal.

column2: Mix with some sweetbread and mushrooms chopped.
column3: Mix with some sweetbread and mushrooms chopped.

column2: Season with salt, pepper and lemon-juice.
column3: Season with salt, pepper and lemon juice.

column2: Add a sprig of parsley and a little onion chopped fine.
column3: Add a sprig of parsley and a little onion chopped fine.

column2: Mix with a beaten egg and bread-crumbs; sprinkle with nutmeg.
column3: Mix with a beaten egg and bread crumbs; sprinkle with nutmeg.

column2: Form into croquettes.
column3: Form into croquettes.

column2: Dip in beaten egg and fine bread-crumbs and fry in deep hot lard.
column3: Dip in beaten egg and fine bread crumbs and fry in deep hot lard.

column2: Serve hot with a cream sauce.
column3: Serve hot with a cream sauce.

column2: 13.--German Cheese Pie.
column3: thirteen.--German Cheese Pie.

column2: Line a pie-plate with a rich pie-dough.
column3: Line a pie plate with a rich pie dough.

column2: Mix well.
column3: Mix well.

column2: Fill the pie.
column3: Fill the pie.

column2: Sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon and bake until light brown.
column3: Sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon and bake until light brown.

column2: Serve hot or cold.
column3: Serve hot or cold.

column2: 14.--Italian Veal Pates.
column3: fourteen.--Italian Veal Pates.

column2: Chop cooked veal with some onion, parsley, thyme and 1 clove of garlic; season with salt, pepper and nutmeg.
column3: Chop cooked veal with some onion, parsley, thyme and one clove of garlic; season with salt, pepper and nutmeg.

column2: Add some chopped ham, lemon-juice and 2 eggs.
column3: Add some chopped ham, lemon juice and two eggs.

column2: Mix with bread-crumbs and melted butter.
column3: Mix with bread crumbs and melted butter.

column2: Fill into small pate shells; rub with butter and beaten egg.
column3: Fill into small pate shells; rub with butter and beaten egg.

column2: Place a paper over the top and let bake in a moderate oven.
column3: Place a paper over the top and let bake in a moderate oven.

column2: Serve with tomato-sauce.
column3: Serve with tomato sauce.

column2: 15.--Hungarian Noodle Pudding.
column3: fifteen.--Hungarian Noodle Pudding.

column2: Add the beaten whites.
column3: Add the beaten whites.

column2: Line the pudding-dish with a rich pie-paste.
column3: Line the pudding dish with a rich pie paste.

column2: Fill with the noodles and pour over some melted butter. Bake until brown.
column3: Fill with the noodles and pour over some melted butter. Bake until brown.

column2: Serve hot with lemon sauce.
column3: Serve hot with lemon sauce.

column2: 16.--Polish Stewed Chicken.
column3: sixteen.--Polish Stewed Chicken.

column2: Let cook until tender and serve on a platter with cooked rice.
column3: Let cook until tender and serve on a platter with cooked rice.

column2: 17.--Madras Curried Apples.
column3: seventeen.--Madras Curried Apples.

column2: Peel and core 4 sour apples and cut into rings; then sprinkle with curry-powder and let fry until tender.
column3: Peel and core four sour apples and cut into rings; then sprinkle with curry powder and let fry until tender.

column2: Add a few thinly cut shallots. Cover and let simmer until done.
column3: Add a few thinly cut shallots. Cover and let simmer until done.

column2: Serve on a platter with boiled rice and pour over a curry sauce.
column3: Serve on a platter with boiled rice and pour over a curry sauce.

column2: 18.--Irish Batter Cakes.
column3: eighteen.--Irish Batter Cakes.

column2: Beat the yolks of 4 eggs; add a pinch of salt, 1 tablespoonful of melted butter, 1 small cup of milk and sifted flour enough to make a smooth batter.
column3: Beat the yolks of four eggs; add a pinch of salt, one tablespoonful of melted butter, one small cup of milk and sifted flour enough to make a smooth batter.

column2: Beat well.
column3: Beat well.

column2: Add the whites of eggs, beaten stiff and let fry a golden color; then spread with jam and serve hot.
column3: Add the whites of eggs, beaten stiff and let fry a golden color; then spread with jam and serve hot.

column2: 19.--Spanish Baked Eggs.
column3: nineteen.--Spanish Baked Eggs.

column2: Poach eggs as soft as possible.
column3: Poach eggs as soft as possible.

column2: Butter a baking-dish; add a layer of bread-crumbs and grated cheese.
column3: Butter a baking dish; add a layer of bread crumbs and grated cheese.

column2: Place the eggs on the crumbs; sprinkle with salt, pepper, grated cheese and chopped parsley.
column3: Place the eggs on the crumbs; sprinkle with salt, pepper, grated cheese and chopped parsley.

column2: Cover with bread-crumbs and pour over some cream sauce.
column3: Cover with bread crumbs and pour over some cream sauce.

column2: Let bake in a hot oven until brown on top.
column3: Let bake in a hot oven until brown on top.

column2: Serve with toast.
column3: Serve with toast.

column2: 20.--Scotch Stewed Onions.
column3: twenty.--Scotch Stewed Onions.

column2: Heat 2 tablespoonfuls of butter.
column3: Heat two tablespoonfuls of butter.

column2: Add the onions; let boil up and serve.
column3: Add the onions; let boil up and serve.

column2: 21.--German Baked Cabbage.
column3: twenty one.--German Baked Cabbage.

column2: Chop all the cabbage from the inside and fry in hot grease with 1 sliced onion.
column3: Chop all the cabbage from the inside and fry in hot grease with one sliced onion.

column2: Remove from the fire.
column3: Remove from the fire.

column2: Let bake until brown.
column3: Let bake until brown.

column2: Serve hot.
column3: Serve hot.

column2: 22.--Dutch Veal Stew.
column3: twenty two.--Dutch Veal Stew.

column2: Season 3 pounds of veal with salt, pepper and lemon-juice.
column3: Season three pounds of veal with salt, pepper and lemon juice.

column2: Put a few slices of bacon in a stew-pan; when hot, add the veal.
column3: Put a few slices of bacon in a stew pan; when hot, add the veal.

column2: Cover and let brown a few minutes; then add 2 carrots and 1 onion sliced thin, some thyme and mace; pour over 1 cup of hot water.
column3: Cover and let brown a few minutes; then add two carrots and one onion sliced thin, some thyme and mace; pour over one cup of hot water.

column2: Cover and let cook slowly until tender.
column3: Cover and let cook slowly until tender.

column2: 23.--French Baked Apple Dumplings.
column3: twenty three.--French Baked Apple Dumplings.

column2: Peel and core apples; sprinkle well with sugar.
column3: Peel and core apples; sprinkle well with sugar.

column2: Then mix some cold boiled rice with 1 egg, a pinch of salt, sugar and cinnamon, flour enough to make a dough.
column3: Then mix some cold boiled rice with one egg, a pinch of salt, sugar and cinnamon, flour enough to make a dough.

column2: Cover the apples with the dough; put in a well-buttered baking-dish with 2 tablespoonfuls of butter and bake to a delicate brown.
column3: Cover the apples with the dough; put in a well buttered baking dish with two tablespoonfuls of butter and bake to a delicate brown.

column2: Serve with whipped cream.
column3: Serve with whipped cream.

column2: 24.--Bavarian Fried Brains.
column3: twenty four.--Bavarian Fried Brains.

column2: Clean and boil the brains in salted water; add 1 onion sliced; let cook ten minutes.
column3: Clean and boil the brains in salted water; add one onion sliced; let cook ten minutes.

column2: Remove the brains and mash up well with 1 tablespoonful of butter, some bread-crumbs and parsley chopped, salt and pepper to taste; add 2 eggs.
column3: Remove the brains and mash up well with one tablespoonful of butter, some bread crumbs and parsley chopped, salt and pepper to taste; add two eggs.

column2: Mix together and fry in deep hot lard by the tablespoonful until brown.
column3: Mix together and fry in deep hot lard by the tablespoonful until brown.

column2: Serve with tomato-sauce.
column3: Serve with tomato sauce.

column2: 25.--Polish Bread Pudding.
column3: twenty five.--Polish Bread Pudding.

column2: Mix well and bake until brown; then beat the whites to a stiff froth with 3 tablespoonfuls of pulverized sugar.
column3: Mix well and bake until brown; then beat the whites to a stiff froth with three tablespoonfuls of pulverized sugar.

column2: Spread the pudding with jelly and cover with the beaten whites; set in the oven to brown.
column3: Spread the pudding with jelly and cover with the beaten whites; set in the oven to brown.

column2: 26.--Vienna Cherry Cake.
column3: twenty six.--Vienna Cherry Cake.

column2: Stone black cherries.
column3: Stone black cherries.

column2: Sprinkle the dough with flour and cover with the cherries.
column3: Sprinkle the dough with flour and cover with the cherries.

column2: Sprinkle with sugar and let bake until done. Then cover with a sweetened egg custard and bake until brown. Serve cold.
column3: Sprinkle with sugar and let bake until done. Then cover with a sweetened egg custard and bake until brown. Serve cold.

column2: 27.--Belgian Poached Eggs.
column3: twenty seven.--Belgian Poached Eggs.

column2: Cut thin round slices of bread and toast them.
column3: Cut thin round slices of bread and toast them.

column2: Spread with chopped anchovies and chopped ham.
column3: Spread with chopped anchovies and chopped ham.

column2: Cover the top with whipped whites of eggs and place a raw yoke on each slice of bread.
column3: Cover the top with whipped whites of eggs and place a raw yoke on each slice of bread.

column2: Set in the oven to bake long enough to heat the egg, and serve at once.
column3: Set in the oven to bake long enough to heat the egg, and serve at once.

column2: 28.--Bavarian Apple Pie.
column3: twenty eight.--Bavarian Apple Pie.

column2: Let bake and fill with chopped apples, raisins and chopped nuts, sugar and a pinch of cinnamon and nutmeg.
column3: Let bake and fill with chopped apples, raisins and chopped nuts, sugar and a pinch of cinnamon and nutmeg.

column2: Then cover with cake-crumbs and let bake until done.
column3: Then cover with cake crumbs and let bake until done.

column2: Beat 3 whites of eggs with pulverized sugar; flavor with lemon and spread over the pudding.
column3: Beat three whites of eggs with pulverized sugar; flavor with lemon and spread over the pudding.

column2: Set in the oven a few minutes to brown on top.
column3: Set in the oven a few minutes to brown on top.

column2: 29.--Russian Fried Sweetbreads.
column3: twenty nine.--Russian Fried Sweetbreads.

column2: Clean and season the sweetbreads with salt and pepper and sprinkle with lemon-juice and chopped parsley.
column3: Clean and season the sweetbreads with salt and pepper and sprinkle with lemon juice and chopped parsley.

column2: Roll in fine bread-crumbs and fry in hot lard.
column3: Roll in fine bread crumbs and fry in hot lard.
